thread.title: Hundreds join Democratic lawmakers on Supreme Court steps to protest immigration order
thread.title_full: Hundreds join Democratic lawmakers on Supreme Court steps to protest immigration order

author: Tracie Mauriello / Post-Gazette Washington Bureau
title: Hundreds join Democratic lawmakers on Supreme Court steps to protest immigration order

organizations.name: associated press the supreme court building

text:
Hundreds join Democratic lawmakers on Supreme Court steps to protest immigration order January 30, 2017 6:00 PM Associated Press The Supreme Court Building in Washington, D.C. By Tracie Mauriello / Post-Gazette Washington Bureau 
WASHINGTON — More than 400 people are gathered on the steps of the Supreme Court ahead of the planned appearance of House Minority Leader Nancy Pelosi, U.S. Sen. Bob Casey and other Democratic leaders to discuss President Donald Trump’s immigration ban. 
The event was scheduled as a press conference, but has turned into an impromptu rally, with chants of “No ban! No wall” and “No hate, no fear! Immigrants are welcome here!” The crowd has been growing steadily in advance of the planned 6 p.m. event. 
President Donald Trump issued an executive order banning immigrants from seven mostly Muslim countries on Friday. It has sparked confusion at airports and worldwide protests.
